event.title: moved quickly at its Monday night

data.event: FALLS VILLAGE—The Region 1 Board of Education moved quickly at its Monday night meeting to approve a proposed budget for the 2009-10 fiscal year reflecting a 1.99 percent increase in spending, a decision precipitated by several revisions and budgetary workshops.

event.title: Monday, when one of the hallways flooded

data.event: On Monday, when one of the hallways flooded, Mr. Peterson was forced to tend to the situation.

event.title: produced the largest increase in the budget due last year

data.event: Business Manager Sam Herrick continues to negotiate for a lower health care insurance renewal rate with Anthem Blue Cross, which produced the largest increase in the budget due last year’s high claim rate.

Manning and Herrick visited residents in Sharon, Cornwall and Salisbury, members of Kent’s Board of Finance attended previous workshops and a meeting with the Canaan Board of Finance is scheduled for this week, thus ensuring that the Region 1 Board reviews the 1.99 percent increase directly with the member towns.
It is scheduled for March 31 at 7 p.m.
